com.utilities

Class TileRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.utilities.TileRecord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TileRecord>

    public final class TileRecord
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<TileRecord>, java.io.Serializable
    Encapsulates a tile record, for Dijkstra's Algorithm, mostly.
    Author:
    Ian
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setDistance

        public void setDistance(int new_distance,
               java.util.PriorityQueue<TileRecord> containing)
        Set the distance to this tile record, Dijkstra's-Algorithm-wise.
        Parameters:
        new_distance - the new distance.
        containing - the priority queue that contains the tile record. Needed because Java is retarded and its priority queue implementation is broken. The hackish workaround it to remove the tile record and then reinsert it.

      • getDistance

        public int getDistance()
        Returns the distance to this tile record, Dijkstra's-Algorithm-wise.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(TileRecord new_parent)
        Sets the parent of this tile record, Dijkstra's-Algorithm-wise.
        Parameters:
        new_parent - the parent of the tile record.

        Parameters:

        tr2 - the second tile record.
